ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Use of chemical biology techniques such as bio-orthogonal reactions, activity based protein profiling, phage assisted continuous evolution, etc... for studying biology. General overview of many topics in chemical bio

A great many areas that I could see myself researching in the future. Lots of different techniques for tracking proteins or other small molecules, developing effective proteins for different functions, and a bit of how the body works.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought this class was really well organized, with each lecture devoted to its own important topic in chemical biology. In addition, the independent proposal part of the class was quite interesting and gave me valuable, practical information about how to write a grant proposal. I thought the first exam was quite unlike the problem sets, but this was adjusted for the second exam.
The lectures seemed rather disjointed sometimes, with the lectures of the two professors overlapping sometimes. The concepts covered were very interesting though

Sometimes you need to do a little outside research, but If you know that from the beginning itll be fine. Both teachers are really good lecturers even though its obvious that its not their first priority. They are also great people to know if youre interested in biochem, MD, MD PhD, etc. lots of experience between the two. The Ta was a lifesaver.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would. The material is very interesting, and the independent proposal is one of the most practical things you will learn to do at Yale.
Yes, very interesting course for anyone planning on studying chemical biology or using chemistry to study biology. Great intro to many areas in this up-and-coming field

Yes. Very great course for any researchers out there. If youve ever felt disappointed because other classes just review western blot and Mass Spec over and over, this class is for You. If youve already learned about biochem this class will teach you how to study biochem in vivo.
Yes! As a chem major, enjoyed this course more than biochem, although biochem background was certainly relevant.
